item.title: Just a question
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

ok som im makin a cln system and i was wondering if this would work. im putting my clan stuff above the castle wars stuff.

[code] /////Zamorak Stuff/////

if (objectID == 2573 && (objectX == XXXX) && (objectY == XXXX) && (playerIsInZamorakClan == false))
{
sendMessage(“You need to be in the Zamorak Clan to open this chest.”);
}
else if (objectID == 2573 && (objectX == XXXX) && (objectY == XXXX) && (playerIsInZamorakClan == true))
{
addItem(randomZamorakChest();, 1);
}
if (objectID == 4388 && (objectX == XXXX) && (objectY == XXXX) && (playerIsInZamorakClan == false))
{
sendMessage(“You need to be in the Zamorak Clan to go through this portal.”);
}
else if (objectID == 4388 && (objectX == XXXX) && (objectY == XXXX) && (playerIsInZamorakClan == true))
{
teleportToX = XXXX;
teleportToY = XXXX;
}
if (objectID == 2874 && (objectX == XXXX) && (objectY == XXXX) && (playerIsInZamorakClan == false) && (playerIsInSaradominClan == true || playerIsInGuthixClan == true))
{
playerIsInZamorakClan = true;
savechar();
BufferedWriter bw = null;
sendMessage(“You are now in the Zamorak Clan”);
try {
bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(“logs/zamorak.txt”, true));
bw.write(playerName+" is in the zamorak clan");
bw.newLine();
bw.flush();
} catch (IOException ioe) {
ioe.printStackTrace();
} finally {
if (bw != null)
try {
bw.close();
} catch (IOException ioe2) {
sendMessage(“Error with logging!”);
}
}
}
else if (objectID == 2874 && (objectX == XXXX) && (objectY == XXXX) && (playerIsInZamorakClan == true))
{
sendMessage(“You are already in the Zamorak Clan”);
}[/code]

or if i have to do it with cases (i hate those damn cases). anyone got an answr?

Read full topic
